data.text: @GhausHussain @FaheemYounus We always knew this. Adults were too hysterical to process the data and act accordingly.

@GhausHussain @FaheemYounus We've known since March 2020.

See papers published on Wuhan fatality demographics in Dec2019-Feb2020.

And further papers from Italy soon after.

It's been the most salient fact about the pandemic.  A blessing.

But we stupidly ignored it.

@HariIniWinda @FaheemYounus Put it this way, excepting those under 1, your risk basically doubles every 5 years.

Those under 1 don't fit the pattern.  But that age is more likely to die of all causes.
@FaheemYounus but how about Covid-19's impact to the kids.., long covid..?

@FaheemYounus Unique and rapidly changing biology of children.

Significant portion of global population are younger children.

Delicate balancing act between urgency and caution for children vaccination.

Below 12 years kids can't give consent,one of the old complex regulations.
@FaheemYounus Maybe because they were over isolated the numbers are low… god forbid they were over exposed 🙏🏻

@FaheemYounus None of this touches on 2 important factors. #1 kids who don’t die and aren’t isolated kill others. IE: it would be nice if we could show which age group kills the most others.

#2 broad and permanent organ damage occurs in every age group and health status. This includes brain.
@FaheemYounus Yea right, lets expose them to equalize the graph
